articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said on Tuesday it struck dozens of Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon overnight, a day after it launched a wave of airstrikes against the Iran-backed group's sites in Lebanon's deadliest day in decades.
articles.title: Israel and Hezbollah exchange fire after Lebanon suffers huge casualties

articles.author: David Lewis, Jessica Donati, Kaylee Kang
articles.description: Conflict in the sub-Saharan Sahel region rarely garners global headlines, yet it is contributing to a sharp rise in migration towards Europe.
articles.title: Why West Africa is now the world's terrorism hotspot

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan called for U.S. sanctions blocking some defence purchases by his country and for other "unilateral" measures that hinder the NATO allies' ability to hit long-term bilateral trade targets to be lifted.
articles.title: Turkey's Erdogan calls for US to lift sanctions hindering defence purchases

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will look to burnish his foreign policy legacy in a U.N. speech on Tuesday, still facing the challenges posed by Ukraine's effort to repel Russian invaders and in a Middle East mired in war.
articles.title: Biden to address UN General Assembly for the last time as president

articles.author: Devjyot Ghoshal, Ruma Paul
articles.description: Bangladesh's army chief vowed to back the country's interim government "come what may" to help it complete key reforms after the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, so that elections could be held within the next 18 months.
articles.title: Bangladesh army chief pledges support for Yunus' interim government 'come what may'

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Tuvalu and its 11,000 people, who live on nine atolls scattered across the Pacific, are running out of time.
articles.title: Sinking Tuvalu fights to keep maritime boundaries as sea levels rise

articles.author: Farah Master
articles.description: China's move to raise retirement ages is a starting point to plug gaping pension deficits and bolster a shrinking workforce but more pain lies ahead as the economy slows, making further reforms urgent, say economists and demographers.
articles.title: China's retirement age reforms not enough to fix pension headache

articles.author: Xinghui Kok
articles.description: Singapore's former Transport Minister S. Iswaran has pleaded guilty to receiving gifts while in office, local media reported, as proceedings began on Tuesday in a rare graft trial involving a state official in this Asian financial hub.
articles.title: Ex-minister Iswaran pleads guilty in graft case that has gripped Singapore

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Former cryptocurrency executive Caroline Ellison is set to be sentenced on Tuesday for her role in her imprisoned former boyfriend Sam Bankman-Fried's theft of about $8 billion in customer funds from the now-bankrupt FTX exchange he founded.
articles.title: Bankman-Fried's ex-girlfriend Ellison to be sentenced over crypto fraud

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Iran's Quds Force commander told Iraqi political leaders last week to ease criticism of the prime minister who has been embroiled in a row over spying allegations, sources said, seeking to steady a regional ally as conflict in the Middle East flares.
articles.title: Iran seeks to calm Iraqi infighting over spy row as region flares up
